comments.body: What's the purpose of this signature? (I just don't have enough knowledge of `never` usage)

Because Gulp extends Orchestrator, and Orchestrator's task() definition is different. 
See https://github.com/gulpjs/gulp/blob/master/index.js#L14
Without this `task(name: string): never;` line, the TypeScript compiler gives an error about the method signatures on line 28 and 39 differing from the Orchestrator.task() signature.
I see.  Gulp doesn't extend Orchestrator's task in a straightforward way...  It's very interesting there is such kind of workaround.  Thanks for the explanation!
